noun.description: In certain vertebrates, especially reptiles and amphibians: a bone or cartilage attached to the coracoid bone, forming part of the pectoral girdle.

adjective.description: Of the nature of an epicoracoid; of or relating to an epicoracoid.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Richard Owen (1804–1892), comparative anatomist and palaeontologist. From epi- + coracoid.
